website_summaries.verdict: Excellent photo quality. A solid choice, but we recommend the D3300 for a little more performance at a similar price.
pros: Users agree that this is a superb basic DSLR that takes great photos right out of the box
Packed with all the most commonly-used features
cons: Some users complain about its heft and a sometimes confusing interface

customer_reviews.title: D3200 with 18-55 mm VR II lens
customer_reviews.text: working as expected got it with the 18-55 mm VR II lens for me most usable for both. Everything working fine, just the USB sometimes not stick is little lose or maybe the cable , replaced and will see lens working fantastic, bellow shots from today on 18-55 mm VR II lens , yes VR II surprise surprise what else to say, love it ! A picture is worth a thousand words bellow just some tests from today nothing fabulous
customer_reviews.author: Miss KayTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I recieved the wrong camera!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Nikon D3200, and after waiting days finally got it! A few days went by using the camera and it was good but something's were off. I watched a review of the camera on YouTube and noticed the side inputs were backwards from what I had. Also I noticed that my USB input was a mini USB and not a micro which seemed odd. When I plugged my camera into my computer today the file said 3100. Upon further inspection, I noticed the bottom said 3100. Make sure your camera is what it says it is!
customer_reviews.author: Blake B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased with My Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Just like brand new. No nicks, no dings, no wear whatsoever. I almost paid close to $600 at Best Buy before finding this DEAL on Amazon. This is an awesome camera at a fantastic price. Do yourself and your bank account a favor and buy one of these if DSLR is what you are looking for. You will be very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Superextra

customer_reviews.title: This being my first SLR camera I have learned a ...
customer_reviews.text: This being my first SLR camera I have learned a lot from just a little playing around. I would strongly suggest watching a few introductory videos on YouTube to get used to the functions. However, this camera package packs a lot in to a a cheaper price. Highly recomend a tripod for new photographers. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Austin D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for photo and video
customer_reviews.text: Six years later, and I'm really happy with my purchase. I have taken this thing in countless vacations. Nowadays I use to record video lectures, which you can do with a tripod, a cheap video card, and an HDMI cable. The only issue that comes to mind is the autofocus on video mode. It's too sensitive and shifts too much for my purposes, which is distracting, so I just keep it off and manually refocus every time I change position, which I try not to do very often.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Javier

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and can make anyone seem like they've been shooting for years. simple ease of use and Nikon has always been my favorite. I grew up shooting 35mm and taking this to the 35mmDSLR this was the best transition camera for me. Hind sight tells me I should have looked at a few other features but this is a bargain at this price. I think I would however opt for just the camera body and buy a lens with a better F stop. 1.8 or at least a 2.8 allowing for better night time photography. Night life, restaurants or stars in the sky. this is a great first camera as it is though. no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. The only drawback I have is that the camera won't let you take anymore photos when the batter still has juice left due to "low battery".. I want to be able to run my battery all the way down to 0% while I'm taking photos. I was unprepared for this when I first started using it and was bummed that I had to stop taking photos sooner than I anticipated because the camera literally locks the shutter and doesn't let you take anymore while there's still plenty of battery left. There may be some reason for Nikon to do this, but I have no clue what it is. Besides this, it's a great quality camera!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: but the 3200's features work better for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement. I dropped my previous D3200 in the river. I thought about upgrading to a D3300 or D3400, but the 3200's features work better for me. I use a remote shutter cable a lot more than an IRF. The 3300 and 3400 eliminate that port in favor of HDMI. That's fine if you plan to do a lot of video work. I do not. I also considered going full-frame with a D750. But, after sending off a few shots for professional printing at 16 x 24 and seeing the results, I can wait until later. I'm basically a hobbyist and the D3200 does everything I need at the moment. This used camera was like new. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Lester Graham

customer_reviews.title: No words do it justice
customer_reviews.text: This was the first DSLR that I purchased. I had a fixed-lens Fujifilm that I bought in the past, but I was ready for an upgrade. I spent about 2 weeks researching all the camera options out at the moment, and this was the winner. I could not be happier with my choice. It is a little more expensive than the D3100 and Canon Rebel T3, but I believe it to be worth every penny. The pictures I took in the first day were better than anything I had taken in the past. The camera is just so easy to use, anyone can pick it up and take wonderful pictures.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sicinski

customer_reviews.title: Excellent DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I remember buying some of the first DSLR's when they came out and they were a pinhole box compared to this baby. Things have come a long way and the D3200 still stands out of the crowd. Fast, light, incredibly responsive and just all around easy to use. The image quality is INSANE! Every detail or my my landscape or portraits is captured in perfection. WARNING do no not take "nudes" with this camera, every pube and freckle can been seen in high definition and for some people this could be detrimental to their self esteem. Other than than that, cool camera!
customer_reviews.author: Ghostbuster

customer_reviews.title: Great basic to mid- level DSLR, excellent value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Best DSLR camera out there, third Nikon DSLR I have purchased, very happy with them all. This one was a present for my wife, and she is extremely happy with it. She tends to use the presets, which combined with our incredible scenery here in Alaska has allowed her to produced some incredible pictures with ease. If you care to challenge your self more and use the manual settings it produces excellent results. In this manner I have used this Nikon for Northern Lights photography with excellent results in weather as cold as 50 below zero Fahrenheit, and it functions flawlessly time and again. Highly recommend it, a great camera, excellent value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with a Nikon and the D3200 is just plain fun and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of research on cameras in the $400-$600 range and the Nikon D3200 just came out on top. I have been a long time Nikon user and have a number of their higher-end DSLRs and they work, they take great photos and are made to last. They only drawback which is minor is the lens that comes with it, is good and takes nice photos but with a good lens like the 17-55 f2.8, wow ... you can really see the power of the sensor in this camera. I bought two and with my $1200 lens, it is better than my D2X and D300, better color, saturation and overall sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: Randall G. Rich

customer_reviews.title: the autofocus is terrible sometimes, other times it just works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: the autofocus is terrible sometimes, other times it just works perfectly. the setup for the manual focus is kinda crappy. but it takes great pictures and really nice videos. I have a stack of SD cards and extra batteries. I use this camera all the time, only broke the lens once so far, thank god for the squaretrade warrantly. I had it hanging around my neck and walked too close to a wall, it lightly bounced off the wall and the focus part broke. warranty fixed it up like brand new and it works great again. love it
customer_reviews.author: tommyboy

customer_reviews.title: Best entry level DSLR so far
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera. I am an amateur photographer and I decided to go for this camera about six months ago. I heard a lot of good reviews and decided to buy it. I fell in love as soon as I got it. It's really small and light and really does perform splendidly. For an entry level DSLR it has al lot of he features higher priced models. Image quality is great, and there is a variety of accessories and stuff you can do with it. I absolutely recommend this camera to anyone looking to buy their first DSLR. it's really to learn with and doesn't disappoint after you start to get experience.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Juarez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent entry level camera
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, high quality pictures. Excellent entry level DSLR. I am new to photography and bought my wife a D3100 last summer. That is also a great entry level camera. I chose The D3200 because as a beginner I do not have super expensive lenses. The 24.2 megapixels allows me to take shots with my 55-300 lens and crop with better clarity than the D3100. The controls are easy to use. The stock 18-55 VR lens leaves a little to be desired. I would recommend a better 50mm prime lens for indoor shooting (larger aperture range). But with a decent lens, this camera is perfect for beginners. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dubblenikle

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for those starting out
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for those of us that don't know enough about digital slr tech. I was taking crystal clear, vivid color photos right out of the box. I watched a few videos online about using the camera and they've helped immensely. The only downside is that the camera body is pretty heavy on its own.... before I added a lens or a flash or a mount. But that's no big deal. I wish I'd have had this camera on the last dozen vacations! The image quality is crazy good. Great all around camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: BBarnes

customer_reviews.title: This camera + 35mm Nikkor 1.8G lens is a very great combo.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, and great deal. :) There are a lot of reviews that go way more into depth than I will here. I won't waste your time... but do know, that this is what I got after months of research and comparisons. After almost a year of using it, I would recommend this, and put my "nerd seal of approval" on it. Get this, a tripod, and the Nikkor 35mm 1.8G (~$200) prime lens.. and you're set for just about anything! Really great pictures, and easy to learn how to use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dowty

customer_reviews.title: amazing camera package for price
customer_reviews.text: All around great camera package for the price-body, two lenses and high quality bag. It may not be a "professional" grade camera by definition but picture quality it a amazing. I chose non-vr lenses after much reasearch and so far do not regret it. The camera is user friendly for simple use in preprogrammed modes and has seemingly endless shooting possibilities in manual mode. For me it's a simply can't miss. You will not be disappointed if you are looking for a spectacular general everyday use slr. I will say it is better than my brother's Canon equivalent.
customer_reviews.author: Loaf

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner camera
customer_reviews.text: I made the choice to buy myself this camera after searching for good beginners cameras. I think this is a good place to start for any one interested in photography, as it's pretty easy to understand the controls and learn how to operate it manually. I'm still learning more about photography, and this camera has everything I need to help me take more professional looking photos. I think it's a great choice!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First DSLR  Love it.  Have someone walk you through the menu.
customer_reviews.text: My first DSLR. I love it. The price is right and It takes great pictures. If you can find someone that has a similar camera that is your best bet. these can be a lot to learn on your own. The menu functions are really good if you have someone tell you a few things about it. I tried learning it by myself first and I could not get good pictures unless I was in auto. I have had it for about 2 months now and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: C5Galaxy

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I spent many hours researching what DLSR camera would be best for me as a beginner at digital photography. This one received many good reviews, so I waited for a deal with a warranty plan as well. The plan is cheaper than with other vendors and the camera was very competitively priced. Thanks to everyone who takes the time to write reviews, it helped me make an educated decision.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Veasey

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, Nikon D3200 one of the best
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to talk about the camera itself which is one of the best, in my opinion. There's a lot of reviews out there. I just want to say that I am more than glad I bought this refurbished camera for half the price of a new one and it looks and works like a new one. It came with everything that comes with a new one, the only difference and is the only one is the box, so you can get this refurbished for this price or pay double for a nicer box, because that's the only difference between this camera and a new one. God Bless you
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic DSLR camera. Don't be fooled by the price, it's evonomical, takes photos just as well as a camera that costs thousands of dollars, that is if you use it under proper light conditions. I would recommend to anyone who wants to have wonderful memories to look back on in the future. Very sturdy, durable and overall excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even better than the D3100
customer_reviews.text: After I fell and broke my cherished D3100, I ordered the new D3200 as a replacement. It has everything I loved about my 3100 and even more. I love the new red body color option. The camera feels just right in my hand, not too big, not too small. I am far from a professional and I love that this camera lets me shoot with the freedom from thought that I get with a point and shoot but still has all the options available if I want to drill down to a more technical shooting experience. First shots bear out the unsurpassed image quality that drew me to Nikon in the first place. I love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Les Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a backup body for my Nikon D7000. The D7000 only has 16MP and the D3200 has 24MP, but the D7000 has many more features than the D3200. I don't use my D7000 for movies, but thought I'd give it a go on the 3200. The videos were surprisingly good and I was pleased with them even though I had no idea what I was doing. Just read what to do in the user's manual and went for it. Nikon makes excellent cameras and I would recommend this for someone who wants to get expand their photography beyond point and shoot, but not break the bank doing it..
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Purchased years ago, but still a great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera! Bought for my husband as a father's day gift a few years ago, and realized I didn't review it on here. He still loves it! He was a photographer, and wanted a nicer camera for photographing kids' events, car shows, senior portraits, etc. This camera delivered!
customer_reviews.author: meggersn2

customer_reviews.title: Love it like a brother, my brother.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. This camera takes amazing photos. As a beginner who's previous photography experience has been limited to point-and-shoot digital cameras the quality and depth of photos I've taken with the Nikon d3200 are superb as one would expect from any single reflex lens camera. What sets the d3200 apart, in my opinion, is the Guide mode which not only allows you to select the effect or style of photo you want, but also explains the settings on the camera to achieve that effect. The d3200 also shoots full 1080p video and has a wireless remote feature that can be operated via smart phone (which i also have and love as well, but that's a separate review). 5 stars/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D3200
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife and she is getting used to the menus and creative ways to take pictures. It can be set up as a point and shoot camera or set up to give very professional looking pictures. So many whistles and bells. It is not overwhelming to operate. There are menus that give suggestions for shooting different scenes and setting of the aperture and shutter speed and focus to produce really professional looking high quality pictures. And the SLR feature allows you to purchase different lenses for different applications. Really nice sturdy feel to this camera system.
customer_reviews.author: Fred A. Cresce

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Optics satisfy my wife
customer_reviews.text: This is the camera my wife and I own and use for our budding photo business. We've had it two or three years. I liked it (and the price range) so much I bought another one for the company camera at my day job. Nice flexibility with the manual and preset settings, easy manual/auto focus, shutter/aperture priority options, expandability with the hot shoe and digital connections. Easy SD card removal on the side of the camera, so I don't have to remove the quick-release platform to access it. Great continuous shooting and sports capability. Really stops the action cleanly. Nikon optics satisfy my wife. Would I buy it again? I did.
customer_reviews.author: Adry

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera! I’m having some issues with the autofocus. Sometimes I have to switch to manual to be able to take a picture. I’m certain it’s operator error though, as I’m still learning. The guide option has been so helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Toni Menkel

customer_reviews.title: Great Mid-Level DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I think the camera is a great for someone looking for a higher quality D-SLR that doesn't break the bank. The stock lens is okay, but I would recommend also purchasing the 50mm f/1.8G AF-S if you're looking for an everyday go-to lens. I have fairly large hands, and I do feel the camera feels a bit small. I also found adjusting the aperture to be somewhat cumbersome, but this may be because I had become accustomed to another brand. I am extremely happy with the camera. I haven't tried recording yet, but I plan to very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Mister.MurphyTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Old new time.
customer_reviews.text: This camera misses a couple of high end camera features, and almost all settings are through the menu, and it is not weather resistant [nor proof], but it takes fantastic pictures at par with high end cameras. I do not use any of the programmed features, only SPAM [Program, Aperture, Shutter, Manual], and the lenses have no VR [vibration reduction], so it is very much like using and old fashion SLR, but using the digital functions to set your film, and darkroom choices. This camera can be used by beginners and enthusiasts alike.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: works wonderfully i highly recommend the Nikon D3200 to any professional ...
customer_reviews.text: works wonderfully i highly recommend the Nikon D3200 to any professional photographer uses the same lens mount Nikon has used since the 1950's has a 3.5 mm microphone line in port 1080p video support exultant photo quality no need to get the base model ( D3100 ) that lacks microphone in and no need to get the fancy D70 just because it has wifi and faster shutter speed by a whole 2 FPS
customer_reviews.author: Philip Marquis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera/Not the best value
customer_reviews.text: Awesome starter camera. Once you learn how to use it the pictures you can take are very nice. Doesn't take long to learn. The price though isn't a very good deal. You can find the same version with the VR lenses for the same price. I unfortunately didn't figure that out till it was too late but have since replaced the lenses anyway. The quality on the camera though is great!
customer_reviews.author: D. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner when it comes to photography. A couple of my friends recommended me this camera, telling me its a great starter camera. And it did not disappoint! Quality is fantastic, and I am having so much fun with it. After a month or two of practice with this camera, I have moved out of auto and started taking manual photographs. Would totally recommend! Edit: check out Jared Polin on youtube, he has an excellent review and tutorial video on this exact camera
customer_reviews.author: Amaury

customer_reviews.title: Must have for anyone with children! OR Anyone that want a very nice camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is an AMAZING CAMERA! I am in love with the color. Worth every penny, and I would recommend getting a case to protect your investment. I absolutely think this is a MUST HAVE for anyone with child(ren) The Nikon D3200 captures every moment in high quality. The set up is super easy and the battery charges very fast, I also enjoy the feature that tells you approximately how many shots you have left before the battery will run out. It is not the most user friendly if you are use to point and shoot cameras, but if you read the manual (or just sections) for the settings you want it does not take long to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: ashmom86

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This camera still does amazing even though it is fairly outdated I would purchase this for anyone starting for even if you just need a fairly cheap camera.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT DSLR for the Beginner
customer_reviews.text: This is a PERFECT DSLR for a beginner. Very easy to learn. I purchased it before a trip to the lake and got some amazing shots of people wakeboarding and tubing behind the boat. Amazing shutter speed and crystal-clear quality photos! We also purchased this camera just before our wedding and plan to use it for capturing photos throughout the next few years as we start a family. Perfect for the casual photographer who just wants great quality for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for the Price
customer_reviews.text: My first personal DSLR. I usually ascribe to Canon and borrow my friends' Rebels and D's so this was a foray into new territory for me. I wish the camera had a flip screen but other than that the optics are great, the included lens is an excellent starting go-to for any photographer or filmmaker (I use this for both), and I love that you can attach and external microphone when necessary. A great camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got the Nikon D3200 certified refurbished. The camera was in great condition like new. It came with the battery, frame, charger, 18-55mm lens, and a strap (not Nikon). It didn't come with the user manual but this is available for free online. The camera works great and you will need to buy an SD card. The lens doesn't have great zoom obviously and is really just a starter. Would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that takes better pictures than my cell phone!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for my wife, both of us just being point and click type shooters. I love the camera, love the options it has, we have been able to take some fantastic photos, despite our lack of photography skills. If you are interested into getting the most out of this devices features, there are some great videos online that will walk you through it step by step. In our case, the auto setting has served us very well for family photos.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I'm definitely an ameture photographer but I'm getting some of the sharpest, best looking pictures with this camera. I was kind of worried about the size and weight of this camera, but I think the size and weight are the reason I'm getting better photos. It's not heavy by any means but you do have to hold the grip on the right and support the left side. Which of course leads to sharper photos. I have always wanted the smallest digital cameras I could find, but I think for me because they are light I wasn't able to hold them steady enough. It's prefect for me.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: this is an excellent camera. I'm an amateur and it takes fabulous ...
customer_reviews.text: i was nervous to spend so much money online. but my nervousness disappeared immediately. this is an excellent camera. I'm an amateur and it takes fabulous pictures.
customer_reviews.author: noram rae

customer_reviews.title: Great product , Needs simple upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderfull camera.The color recognition is amazing and the images are as sharp as you could want and it can catch the flap of a bees wings. The only thing you have to look out for is the strap . I just took it out for a test run , I was using the strap because i was answering a text and the strap unthread itself from the camera the camera fell on the ground .i was lucky that only the back screen cracked . Advice to others get a better strap with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camera for me
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR after buying a string of point and shoots. I was some what apprehensive thinking if I would be able to get to understand all the intricacies of a DSLR but I have to tell you that if you just spend some time with and experiment for a couple of hours you will be 100% better photographer then when you originally started using it. Nice to hold, light weight, great screen and lots of lenses available in the 2nd hand market. I'm having fun with it. Took some portraits of my kids and they are the best pics I have ever taken; all by following the onscreen guide. Summary: great camera for the virgin DSLR user.
customer_reviews.author: Zain M. Khan

customer_reviews.title: Great Value on a Very Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on reviews, and ratings from buyers. It is a very good camera and I do recommend it. However it did stop focusing on video very soon after buying it, and I sent it back go Nikon for repair. They repaired it but I've not had a chance to test it, the round trip from Nikon was about 10 days with mediocre communication from Nikon. This comes with two lenses, covering the 18mm to 200mm range, which is adequate for most usage. I would call it a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!! I'm very happy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! ! I'm very happy. Even after 6months of almost daily use! Love that I went for this package because it has two lenses that are both excellent quality, and a great nikon carrying case. I was originally saving up for a d3100 which was on my wish list for almost 2years, but by the time I went to finally get this for myself, I upgraded slightly to the d3200. Can't be wrong when all of the reviews and recommendations were so great regarding this upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Mae Green

customer_reviews.title: So far so great...
customer_reviews.text: I've been a photographer since 1989 and at one point even owned a wedding photography company. This camera has done everything I've needed it to in the short while I've owned it. It's gone through a grueling hike in the rain while in Yosemite in the landscape setting and on several manual settings, and its even managed to survive a two year olds birthday party on the sports setting.
customer_reviews.author: Coxx110

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful performance!
customer_reviews.text: Love the size, shape and feel. light weight. had some buddies with older models take a picture with it and they were impressed by the light weight but comparable if not superior performance. professional pictures. loved the bundle. have taken over 3k pictures in 2 weekends and it has not disappointed. great deal!!
customer_reviews.author: home4mk

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Excited
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are leaving to Maui in November, so we bought this camera to use on our trip. Well, I've been practicing with it so I can be ready for our trip and It's absolutely amazing. I've taken pictures of close up roses, which is so crisp and clear then I've taken action shots of my daughter dancing and once again so crisp and clear and I love that I can get her in mid-air. And finally I've taken pictures of my grandson and I love that the color is so perfect. I'm looking forward to getting some great pictures of Maui.
customer_reviews.author: Josette Gibson

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: for the first time in my life, i can take the best photos. this camera is amazing. my daughter is in sports & the action setting makes taking a series of pictures amazing. last week i used the camera to take pictures of a tree service cutting down 2 giant firs. i used the action setting & the pictures that i captured of the trees falling were amazing, So amazing that the tree service asked for the pictures. so COOL.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied

customer_reviews.title: and I absolutely love it. The Red is even prettier in person
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a newbie with a DSLR, I knew only a little going in, and I absolutely love it. The Red is even prettier in person. I've learned more since I got the camera, and am enjoying the features. Nikon is defintely the way to go. If you want a camera to learn on this one is great! Even if you're not just beginning and need a good size camera with good functionality this is it!
customer_reviews.author: ahtx

customer_reviews.title: which enabled me to take good pictures. BUT once I studied the manual a ...
customer_reviews.text: Having upgraded to the D3200 from a simple point and shoot, I initially relied on the clever settings, which enabled me to take good pictures. BUT once I studied the manual a bit, and experimented with the camera's manual settings, I've come to take better and better pictures! This camera is very user-friendly, and it's nice that it comes in a different color. I would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Gill

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS CAMERA! I will say right off the bat, I don't know anything about DSLR cameras - nothing. I really don't know anything about the specs of this camera, but I do know that I came from a point and shoot, and this is a very starter friendly camera! I haven't played around with shutter speed nearly as much as I want to, but anyone can take an amazing picture with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Zin

customer_reviews.title: Great camera at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very versatile camera for both stills and video. It is easy to use, looks great, and takes professional quality shots. If you don't want to break the bank and also take impressive videos and stills, this is a camera you should have. Even if you have one of the higher end Nikon's or Canon's (as do I), you should also have this one as well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Young

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Well, bought a refurbished model and it seems to be taking quite nice photos with no real complaints at this point. There's a lot to learn with it being our first DSLR, but for the money I think it's a steal! Some photos we've taken are pretty darn awesome looking. All the great reviews on YouTube and Amazon helped me make my decision to buy for my 16 year old daughter's B-Day present and she's very happy as I am. g-
customer_reviews.author: Keoki

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: First time working with this camera! I bought it after researching for sometime (I am a budding photographer) so I wanted something that would allow me a challenge, but would not frustrate me beyond reason. The interface is very intuitive, and within minutes I had most everything figured out. I have taken several hundred pictures with it since it arrived in the mail a few days ago (It arrived very early! So that was awesome.) and I really have zero complaints. I am excited to have this camera by my side for several years!
customer_reviews.author: Caitscotch

customer_reviews.title: First DSLR Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great starter DSLR camera. Includes a setting called "guide" that has an easy to navigate interface for those new to DSLRs. I've played with others DSLR Cameras for a while and have been looking to get a good beginner camera. This package came with two great lenses to start your collection, both give you a good range of zoom for an affordable price. Can't find a better deal anywhere (paid $596.95).
customer_reviews.author: zeke

customer_reviews.title: This camera is beautiful and takes amazing photos for the price
customer_reviews.text: This camera is beautiful and takes amazing photos for the price!!! I have been wanting to upgrade to a Nikon Digital SLR for quite sometime now, but didn't have the funding for one that's over $1,000, so this one was just what I needed. I am a semi professional photographer who was getting by with an Olympus camera, thanks to my editing skills, but I've been wanting to upgrade pretty badly. I have only used it a tiny bit, so if any issues come up I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Joi

customer_reviews.title: In love with it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a photography glass and was the best value hands down to buy refurbished instead of getting a brand new camera. Works like new. Takes crystal clear images. I also recommend getting the book "Read This If You Want To Take Great Photographs" if you're a beginner because it will teach you how to use all the different, at first intimidating settings. It's the book we use in my class.
customer_reviews.author: KarenT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife for our most recent trip. She is new to SLR and loved the camera. She watched a few videos on how to use it and started shooting with it. She is not a pro but the pictures came out great. Huge improvement over previous cameras we had before. We bought it over a month ago and while she is still learning to use the different functions/abilities she feels really comfortable using the camera.
customer_reviews.author: David Marta

customer_reviews.title: Great First-Time SLR
customer_reviews.text: This is my first SLR and it is great! It takes wonderful pictures with or without flash and in the dark as well as brighter settings. I got a refurbished one, and it works as if it were new. It didn't come with a usb cable, but once I told the seller, they sent me one. I love the depth of field! I recommend it for those seeking slr's around $500 and beginner photographers!
customer_reviews.author: Mehan

customer_reviews.title: She loves it and I love it, same image sensor as my d5500
customer_reviews.text: Bought this body for my wife ( her first dslr) ....She loves it and I love it, same image sensor as my d5500, quality photos and a fantastic guide mode that walks her through broadening her capabilities with the camera in intuitive step by step ways right there on the camera with her in the field
customer_reviews.author: collin fTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: This camera is a Teacher and I'm the Teacher's Pet
customer_reviews.text: I can't say much more about this unit than has already been said. It is a beginner's dream. I have learned so much by having this camera that would have been such a struggle with any other camera as a newbie. I have already taken some fantastic photos, and videos are not bad as well. I think that when I am ready to move up to the next level this camera body will remain in my bag. I really love this unit, and I continue to grow with it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: After looking over comparable cameras this one blows other in the price range away. Also it is a little higher end in that you can attach external mics and things if you plan to do any video work with it. Although the Nikon glass is more expensive I compared pictures to my friends cannon dslrs and i think this one blew it away. Check around though. There is always some good deals on this camera on different sites
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, my only complaint is the low light - but it performs great in low light - I'm just picky as a filmmaker. And I use it mostly for filmmaking. Amazing camera and easy to use, however if you want manual controls they are just a spin of the dial. Here is my first serious short using this and you can see how clear the film is. I would recommend this camera as a serious contender for a filmmaker. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Rion Smith

customer_reviews.title: refurbished or new?!
customer_reviews.text: Refurbished product looked BRAND NEW on arrival. Popped a SD card in and everything has been running smoothly. Really love this camera. Just the upgrade I was looking for to take pictures for my small business. Picture quality and ease of use is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: BCM

customer_reviews.title: Not a single regret in this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am somewhat new to photography and was nervous about making a purchase this large. However after getting it and using the camera and the accessories, I don't regret the purchase at all. The bag allows everything to be carried, the camera is great, and the additional lens is perfect for far away shots. One of my favorite parts about the purchase is that it came with a pouch for the lens, a battery, charger, and strap. I definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: sydney

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research, I chose the 3200 as my first step up from a point and shoot. I am so impressed. I am only using this in the automatic mode, but this picture quality is just beautiful. Very easy to use. Highly recommend for the person who wants a step up from a small digital camera. The lens bundle is great. One is my "all purpose" lens - the other is a nice zoom. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: tammywithkids

customer_reviews.title: Great to start in photography
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this camera for nearly two years now and I absolutely love it. I've learned everything I know about photography with it, and I totally recommend it if you're a beginner or even have some experience already. The stock lens is very nice and versatile, but you'd probably be better off with 35mm.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Nice light camera, very handy to carry around :)
customer_reviews.text: I like this little camera!! After having a D70 (that always malfunctioned at the worst times) and a D90, this camera is a pleasure to walk around with. It will use the big and heavy lenses I have for the other cameras, but using the supplied VR lenses appears to work just fine. I feel like I can keep this handy at work and in my vehicle for those sudden photo opts.
customer_reviews.author: L. T.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the enthusiastic amateur.
customer_reviews.text: It does everything. Good quality camera with loads of features. While aimed at the advanced hobbyis, this can do what the pros do too. Controls are well located. It has all the automation to take good shots in a hurry,b ut for the great shots you can use manual override to playwith exposure and focus.
customer_reviews.author: Mort Adella

customer_reviews.title: Good for another 6 or 7 years.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera and I have no complaints but, I kind of expected to be able to zoom in on images (jpg fine or raw) and see less pixilation. This camera is 24MP compared to the 10MP Canon G7 it replaces. The variety of lenses and low light capability completely make up for it though. The movie capture at high res detracts a bit though, thus 4 stars. I'm not a camera guru but I would say that the high res movies don't appear 'fluid'.
customer_reviews.author: Hard2Please

customer_reviews.title: perfect in time for Graduation season as my daughter and ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving my camera, perfect in time for Graduation season as my daughter and son graduated this year. Snapped lots of memories!! Would buy another camera if given the opportunity!! This was a great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda C. Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Longtime devotee to Nikon film cameras. This is the first digital that I have been pleased with. I especially like the accompanying software for interfacing with the camera and the automatic transfer and storage of camera variables along with the image. Image quality is sufficient that I no longer lament the passing of film. Even though I still get-out my Nikon film equipment and admire some of the best workmanship in the World.
customer_reviews.author: Doyle K.

customer_reviews.title: My first DSLR, I am very satisfied with the body and the price for the kit
customer_reviews.text: This camera is admittedly an entry level DSLR with no official battery grip support and very few hardware buttons for manual shooting. Regardless, it is an excellent platform for high quality lenses and is compact enough to come with me in my bag. I have had excellent results shooting in lots of lighting conditions. The raw photos are excellent too, very much worth the price of entry. This is a great body to save a few hundred on and spend the money where it really counts, on high quality lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Glinski

customer_reviews.title: I use it for nature and sports and have never taken better pics. I have a lot to learn
customer_reviews.text: this is my third Nikon.... I keep working my way up the levels.... it takes fabulous pictures . I use it for nature and sports and have never taken better pics. I have a lot to learn, so I can't justify the next step up for a while, but it's a great entry level SLR. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Fox

customer_reviews.title: Its a great camera, but I wish I had gotten the ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a great camera, but I wish I had gotten the 5500 with the pop out screen. The feature that says will help teach you to shoot...well I just never use it, not really that great of a selling point. But takes great photos. Its a great starter/intermediate camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jenniferwritesreviews

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for me to start a photography career. All the shots I have taken have been great. Actually I've forgotten I'm amateur with some of what I feel as a pro photos. The camera is really easy to use and well made. I recommend it for all the people who want to learn about the photography world.
customer_reviews.author: farias_manuel

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm just an amateur and just take pictures of family events (vacations, sports, every day life, etc.), and it is perfect for my needs. I really only use the automatic setting..someday I would like to learn how to get my moneys worth with the manual settings though! I like that it comes with two lenses even though I mostly just use the main one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Larrabee

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. It has more features than I can ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. It has more features than I can figure out right now, but the auto modes make it easy for anyone to use. There are plenty of manual settings to satisfy the more savvy photographers. The additional lens is great. The bag is great. This is probably the most bang for your buck when it comes to entry level dslr cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Dan

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great camera for us
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great camera for us. We're not professional photographers, nor would we ever be, so I can't say how good 'professionally it is'. However, we were sick of the mediocre pictures from cheap digital cameras. We've gone through three cheap digital cameras in the past four years and decided to spend a little more money for something nicer. This was a great purchase decision. The camera is easy to set up and even easier to use. The pictures are clear and great quality. I sure wish I would have bought a nice camera a lot sooner!
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: I love my camera!
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner so I didn't want to spend a fortune on a camera that would most likely be way to complex for me. This camera takes great pictures and videos. I'm slowly learning my way around picture taking, and I'm very pleased with my purchase. My subjects are mostly my kids. Maybe down the road some years I'll invest in something more advanced, but this will be just fine for little ol me for now.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera but it has focusing issues
customer_reviews.text: i love this camera but it has focusing issues. When using certain modes and sometimes in manual modes as well, the camera fails to focus. This is usually with the larger lenses, but lately I've been experiencing it with all lenses. There are a few quarks I'm not to fond of either as well as some disabled functions. I upgraded from the D3100 and definitely has sharper image quality but not a permanent replacement. In fact I'm a little more fond of the D300 over this one and that is discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Summers

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with the Nikon D3200
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for my teenage daughters and they like them very much. They have been using them for 6 months and they are both happy with the quality of the photographs. The Nikon D3200 is lightweight and simple to use. It is also great for taking action photos. I used it to take photos of my daughter during a soccer game and I was impressed with the speed of the succession of the photos and how well it captures things in motion.
customer_reviews.author: Willio

customer_reviews.title: the D3200 seems wonderful. Can't wait to receive my new D3300
customer_reviews.text: The refurbished camera I received had several problems (would shut off whenever I tried to enter live view, and would constantly throw an error message asking to press down the shutter). After googling I determined I would have had to send in the camera to Nikon for repair. Consdiering I just received the camera "new" in the mail, it was not worth it and I returned. I'm now paying $100 extra for the new version, so I do not have to deal with that headache. From the test photos I managed to take, the D3200 seems wonderful. Can't wait to receive my new D3300!
customer_reviews.author: Ananta P.

customer_reviews.title: love my camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been waiting forever to get this camera. I originally wanted black and got red instead BUT color isnt a deal breaker... I'm happy with my purchase and this camera is truly great for my beginning stages so great my boyfriend bought one as well
customer_reviews.author: Tricey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter Digital SLR camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent starter Digital SLR camera. Go on youtube and there are some excellent tutor movies on how to use it and that is a lot easier than reading through instruction books. However you can leave it on automatic and it will give you good pictures. I conquered the delay of the digital camera between shots by setting it up to take multiple shots each time you push the shutter because I was missing too many follow up shots.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Charles

customer_reviews.title: Still snapping
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever camera. I've spent the last few months learning about photography on this camera and I've acquired great results from it. If your a beginner or just wanting great camera that won't destroy your wallet, then this is the camera for you
customer_reviews.author: joaquin gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent camera. I have absolutely loved everything I have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent camera. I have absolutely loved everything I have done with the camera so far. I am learning as much as I can about it to make sure I utilize as much of it's functions as possible. This is a great first timers camera or even a professional
customer_reviews.author: im2bizzie2play

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this camera! I got it for XMAS for my wife, and we have already taken thousands of pictures! Very good quality, and long battery life! I would suggest buying an external microphone if you plan on making videos though, the internal makes everything very loud, and it picks of the auto-focus sound too, which really affects the videos.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha & Aaron

customer_reviews.title: it takes wonderful pictures, but it does take time to get ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a novice to photography. So far, it takes wonderful pictures, but it does take time to get to know your camera and how to operate it efficiently. You need to read and study this camera, just as you would have to do with any advanced camera system. It is not for kids or for those who want instant snapshot prints.
customer_reviews.author: Macmadam

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I bought it because I wanted to learn how to shoot pictures in manual mode.
customer_reviews.author: sisu

customer_reviews.title: Loving this camera
customer_reviews.text: Loving this camera! Looking forward to learning how to utilize all that it can do. No negatives that I can see.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Good For a Beginner
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR, I shoot primarily landscapes and nature stuff, and it works great for me. I am still learning all of the features, but you can, with a little bit of reading/research, take it out of the box and start shooting. I would recommend using some kind of photo-editing software besides the program that comes with the camera as it is lacking some features.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Garner

customer_reviews.title: Love it, love it, love it.
customer_reviews.text: The size is good even tho I have a large hand for a woman and the pictures are just great. I had a minor issue with the first 55-200mm lens that was shipped with it, but Amazon took the initiative and I had a replacement within 2 days. Wow! The camera takes very clear pictures and the auto focus lenses are amazing. My budget is not a large one and I really feel that I got a VERY good camera that works like a dream come true. I took 500 pictures in the first 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Go for it!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this a few days ago. It's so great to have a TTL viewfinder again! Many options. Easy to use. I've been watching You Tube videos of people who take you through all the operations. Lightweight. Fits well in your hand. After trying many digital small cameras with poor results, this is answer to prayer.
customer_reviews.author: DiAM

customer_reviews.title: Started out taking great pictures, currently having problems with autofocus
customer_reviews.text: So far, the camera takes fantastic pictures. But I have begun to have trouble with the autofocus. I am hoping this is not a trend. I will update when I have determined whether or not the autofocus is a consistent problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Scientist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect for beginners and people who do photography as a hobby. It works great, and I have never had any problems with mine so far. If you are looking to shoot high resolution photos but you're not looking for something too pricey, this is the camera for you (just remember to shoot in RAW if you are able to process it). If you are looking to capture really close up shots though, you may want to invest in a better lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice photos even with kit lens!
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes great photos right out of the box using the included kit lens. Manual mode allows you to control all the parameters to bring your artistic perspective to your photos. The program modes provide quick access and also yields very crisp images. The included software processes the Nikon Raw format that gives you ultimate control over the final images. I am going to add a prime lens but I am not at all unhappy with the kit lens.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL L BEITENHAUS

product_meta.title: Nikon D3200 24.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 Auto Focus-S DX VR NIKKOR Zoom Lens (Black) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:w/ 18-55mm| Configuration:BaseDon’t let the D3200’s compact size and price fool you—packed inside this easy to use HD-SLR is serious Nikon.power: a 24.2 MP DX-format CMOS sensor that excels in any light, EXPEED 3 image-processing for fast operation and creative in-camera effects, Full HD (1080p) movie recording, in-camera tutorials and much more. What does this mean for you? Simply stunning photos and videos in any setting. And now, with Nikon’s optional Wireless Mobile Adapter, you can share those masterpieces instantly with your Smartphone or tablet easily. Supplied Accessories: EN-EL14 Rechargeable Li-ion Battery, MH-24 Quick Charger, EG-CP14 Audio/Video Cable, UC-E6 USB Cable, DK-20 Rubber Eyecup, AN-DC3 Camera Strap, DK-5 Eyepiece Cap, BF-1B Body Cap, BS-1 Accessory Shoe Cover and Nikon View NX CD-ROM.1-Year Nikon U.S.A. Warranty. 

Download the user manual.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,707 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
